name: David Letterman
monologue: The groundhog crawled out of his hole today and predicted six more weeks of Oscars hype.

name: David Letterman
monologue: Top Ten Reasons Your Film Wasn't Nominated For An Academy Award

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: The Oscar nominations were announced today. The Best Actor nominees include George Clooney for “Up in the Air,” Jeremy Renner for “The Hurt Locker”, and President Obama for the “State of the Union.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: I read in The New York Times that the Obama administration is planning huge changes to President Bush’s “No Child Left Behind” law. The new law will be called “Let’s Face It, Some Kids Are Just Duds.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: An 8-year-old cat in Britain just became the world’s first cat to have an artificial knee replacement. Vets say the cat should be up and doing nothing in no time.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Police in Indiana are searching for a man who robbed a tobacco store with a pair of scissors. They said the guy could be a real danger — unless you have a rock.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Today is Groundhog Day, the day of the year when all the men in the world that wear top hats get together.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: The animal rights group PETA has asked that they replace Punxsutawney Phil with a robot groundhog. You create one robot groundhog, before you know it, they take over the planet, you have to send people back in time to exterminate them, and then we have no governor any more.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: On Sunday, the 52nd annual Grammy Awards were held. Beyonce set a record, winning 743 Grammys.
